discussion.p: As discussed during the Chicago meeting in SG1 the only reasonable reasons for throwing device_or_resource_busy seem to be:

li.p: The thread currently already holds the mutex, the mutex is not recursive, and the implementation detects this. In this case resource_deadlock_would_occur should be thrown.
Priority reasons. At least std::mutex (and possibly all standard mutex types) should not be setup this way, otherwise we have real problems with condition_variable::wait().

discussion.p: We believe we were already done with it. Should be in SG1-OK status.
SG1 hands this over to LWG for wording review

blockquote.p: This wording is relative to N3936.

li.p: operation_not_permitted — if the thread does not have the privilege to perform the operation.
resource_deadlock_would_occur — if the implementation detects that a deadlock would occur.

p.del: device_or_resource_busy — if the mutex is already locked and blocking is not possible.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4527.

blockquote.p:
[…]
-4- The error conditions for error codes, if any, reported by member functions of the mutex types shall be:

li.p: (4.1) — resource_unavailable_try_again — if any native handle type manipulated is not available.
(4.2) — operation_not_permitted — if the thread does not have the privilege to perform the operation.

p.del: (4.3) — device_or_resource_busy — if any native handle type manipulated is already locked.
